channel.title: [508] Some Door Stuff
channel.description: I've got yet another question. :P How would I rotate a door when it is clicked on? I know I can put code under the correct object ID in the ObjectOption1 class, but how do I rotate the door itself? Thanks!

item.title: [508] Some Door Stuff
item.dc:creator: @xyzz123 xyzz123
item.description:
@xyzz123 wrote:

Lol.

But the question still remains. How can I delete a global object?

Read full topic

item.title: [508] Some Door Stuff
item.dc:creator: @xyzz123 xyzz123
item.description:
@xyzz123 wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:3, topic:245463”][quote author=`Rich link=topic=321901.msg2545133#msg2545133 date=1227230688]
Replace the object with itself, just rotate it around using a different facing.
[/quote]
You gots to speak noob language with him[/quote]

Hmph. You’re presuming a little too much. Your signature says that noobs should be coders, and you’re assuming that I can’t code/am too lazy, neither of which I am, considering that I have extensive C# knowledge, and that, aside from the standard library, C# and Java are very, very similar.

`Rich:

Replace the object with itself, just rotate it around using a different facing.

Thanks for the help! I’ve just got another question… I can use p.frames.createObject to create a new global object, but how do I delete an old one, or get its rotation?

Read full topic
